p: As an important human pathogen, enterovirus type 71 (EV71) is a non-enveloped single-stranded RNA virus, belonging to the family Picornaviridae ( 40) that has three genotypes (A, B and C) and several sub-genotypes ( 41). In recent years, EV71 has been the major pathogenic enterovirus responsible for hand-foot-and-mouth disease epidemics in Asia. Notably, since 2008, large-scale outbreaks of hand-foot-and-mouth disease have been reported yearly in mainland China, which resulted in hundreds of deaths and were caused mainly by the c4a clade of the C4 EV71 subtype ( 42).
